comments.html: Of course, you can configure ACLs that block unexpected incoming TCP packets on port 179. Will the vendors do it for you? Of course not, but they'll be happy to publish outdated pages-long lists of nerd knobs (also known as "device configurations" ;) in their "hardening guides"
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: For the routers that do not have built-in protection that blocks TCP connections from IP addresses (e.g. Arista EOS ) except their known BGP peers, can they not configure ACLs in their BGP configurations to prevent such things?
comments.name: Shyam Khadka
